about.title: 私について
about.description: 私は情熱的なUX/UIデザイナー兼フロントエンド開発者です。
about.paragraph1: 私はフランシスコ・シクスト — 堅実な技術的背景を持つUX/UIデザイナーです。デザインとフロントエンド開発の交差点で働き、明確で効率的、ユーザー中心のデジタル体験を作成しています。物事を複雑にすることなく品質を提供するのに役立つ良いシステム、スマートな反復、実用的なツールを信じています。
about.paragraph2: 長年にわたって、私はデザインと開発チームをリードし、優先事項を調整し、コードとモックアップをレビューし、ウェブサイト、CRM、ポータル全体でスケーラブルなソリューションを構築してきました。他の人をメンタリングし、チームのワークフローを改善し、プロセスのあらゆるステップで創造性と明確さのバランスを取ることを楽しんでいます。
about.paragraph3: 私を駆り立てるのは直感的な体験の追求です — 構造、インタラクション、美学が自然に一致する種類のものです。Figma、VS Code、またはチームコールで作業しているかどうかに関係なく、物事をより良く機能させ、よりスムーズに感じさせ、目的を持ってユーザーにサービスを提供する方法について常に考えています。
about.paragraph4: 仕事以外では、スポーツ、家族や友人との時間、オフラインでのシンプルな瞬間を楽しんでいます。日常生活 — 会話、共有された食事、または私が大切に思う人々と一緒にいることから多くのインスピレーションを得ています。

projectsData.title: Officina Artis: A Virtual 3D Art Gallery Exploring Space, Interaction, and Curation
projectsData.description: I designed and developed a 3D immersive experience to explore artworks in a virtual gallery, combining creative coding, spatial storytelling, and artistic direction.
projectsData.imageAlt: 3D view of the Officina Artis virtual gallery
projectsData.longDescription:
👉 **Role**: Creative Director & 3D Developer
📍 **Format**: Self-initiated project

---

🎨 **What I did**

- Designed the concept and structure of a virtual art gallery where users explore curated exhibitions in a 3D space
- Developed interactive navigation with smooth camera transitions, lighting systems, and environmental audio
- Created a modular architecture to host rotating exhibits, integrating both personal and invited works

💡 **Creative goals**

- Simulate the contemplative experience of physical art galleries using real-time 3D
- Explore curation as a spatial narrative: how position, lighting, and transitions affect perception
- Combine minimal UI with spatial UX to let the environment communicate meaning

🛠️ **Tools & tech**

Three.js, WebGL, Blender, GLSL, HTML, CSS, JavaScript
→ Fully web-based experience, optimized for desktop browsers

🧠 **Design philosophy**

Officina Artis is both an artwork and a space for art. It challenges the idea of a gallery as static architecture, instead treating it as a living interface between creator and audience. Each exhibition is a narrative told through layout, rhythm, and silence.

---

I created Officina Artis as a way to merge my passions for visual design, code, and contemporary art. It’s a self-directed experiment that pushes the boundaries of interaction and curatorial storytelling in virtual environments.

As Creative Director and Developer, I handled every aspect—from the spatial design and lighting to the code that powers movement and ambiance. The result is an elegant, contemplative digital space that reimagines how we engage with artworks online.

Officina Artis represents my personal design philosophy: minimal, poetic, experimental, and deeply human-centered. It’s not just a tech demo—it’s a statement about how form, space, and code can evoke emotion and presence in the digital age.

projectsData.title: Transforming Education Online: UX Strategy and Scalable Design for 20+ University Sites
projectsData.description: I led the design and development of digital experiences across multiple markets, combining strategy, technology, and teamwork to transform over 20 educational websites and boost usability and conversion.
projectsData.imageAlt: Sites and Applications created at Start University
projectsData.longDescription:
👉 **Role**: UX/UI and Frontend Development Lead
📍 **Markets**: Latam and India

---

🔧 **What I did**

- Designed and developed digital experiences for 20+ websites (universities, aggregators, blogs)
- Led a team of designers and frontend developers
- Delivered visual design, HTML/CSS builds, code reviews, and fast marketing solutions

📈 **Key results**

- Migrated and redesigned 5 legacy websites to .NET Core
- Built 7 new sites from a shared base system
- Increased conversions through optimized landings, forms, and campaigns

💡 **Major innovations**

- Standardized the **Student Portal**: unified UX/UI across all institutions with minimal CSS overrides
- Redesigned aggregators: consistent UI across different databases, adapted per region with localized assets

🛠️ **Tools & tech**

Figma, Bootstrap, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, .NET Core, Jira, SourceTree
→ Accessibility and SEO best practices included in every delivery

🤝 **Soft skills**

Leadership, decision-making, collaboration with content, marketing, and sales teams

---

At Start University, I held the role of UX/UI and Frontend Development Lead, driving the creation of high-impact digital experiences across key markets like Latin America and India. My work combined strategy, design, and technology to build websites that connected users with educational opportunities.

I led the visual and frontend development of over 20 active websites, including university sites, content aggregators, and blogs. Together with my team—designers and HTML/CSS developers—we handled everything from wireframes and visual design to frontend implementation and code reviews. We also supported the marketing team with quick-turnaround solutions like landing pages, campaign assets, and form optimizations that improved conversion rates.

A significant part of my work involved migrating and redesigning outdated websites to .NET Core. This process included aligning the brand identity of each educational institution and enhancing user experience across platforms. We successfully migrated five client university websites and established a reusable base system that allowed us to launch seven new sites for incoming partners faster and more efficiently.

One of my biggest achievements was the standardization of the student portal. Previously, each site had its own version, requiring individual updates. I designed a modular, unified portal interface that adapted to different institutions with minimal CSS changes. This greatly streamlined development, reduced maintenance time, and delivered a consistent experience to all users.

I also led the redesign of content aggregators to ensure visual consistency across platforms, even though they pulled data from different sources. We achieved a cohesive look and feel using dynamic visual adjustments like color schemes, imagery, and localized branding.

Throughout this role, I used tools such as Figma, Bootstrap, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, .NET Core, Jira, and SourceTree. Accessibility and SEO were integrated into every deliverable by default.

Beyond the technical skills, this experience sharpened my leadership, decision-making, and communication with cross-functional teams like content, marketing, and sales. Start University wasn’t just a job—it was a professional platform where I **founded and led the UX/UI design area**, drove transformation, built scalable solutions, and helped bridge people to education through thoughtful digital design.

projectsData.title: From Engines to Elegance: Digital Ecosystems for Automotive, Hospitality, and Lifestyle Brands
projectsData.description: I designed and developed immersive, high-conversion websites across multiple industries—from automotive platforms with advanced features to high-end hospitality and golf club digital experiences.
projectsData.longDescription:
👉 **Role**: UX/UI Designer & Frontend Developer
📅 **Dates**: Feb 2019 – Aug 2020
📍 **Location**: Córdoba, Argentina

---

🔧 **What I did**

- Led the redesign of Autocity’s automotive catalog with new interactive features: vehicle comparison, pricing estimator, and dynamic filtering
- Created new websites for premium lifestyle and hospitality brands under Grupo Tagle:
  - **Scratch House** (luxury hotel)
  - **El Terrón Golf Club** (exclusive golf resort)
  - **Grupo Tagle corporate website**
  - **Motoplex Córdoba** and **Royal Enfield Córdoba** (motorcycle brands)

📈 **Key results**

- Enhanced user experience across all digital platforms with responsive design and improved navigation
- Delivered on-brand interfaces for each business vertical, adapting tone and visual identity accordingly
- Increased lead generation with improved UX in quotation and inquiry flows

💡 **Major innovations**

- Developed a vehicle comparison tool that simplified decision-making for users
- Streamlined internal CMS workflows for updating catalogs and brand content
- Applied tailored design systems to balance premium aesthetics and usability

🛠️ **Tools & tech**

Adobe XD, Illustrator, Photoshop, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Bootstrap
→ Focus on responsive design, performance optimization, and brand storytelling

🤝 **Soft skills**

Client communication, adaptability across industries, attention to detail, iterative design, team collaboration

---

During my time at Autocity and Grupo Tagle, I worked on digital platforms that spanned diverse industries—from the fast-paced world of automotive sales to the refined experiences of luxury hospitality and golf.

One of the core achievements was the revamp of Autocity’s car catalog. We introduced powerful tools for users to compare models, estimate prices, and filter options with ease, resulting in a far more engaging and practical browsing experience.

In parallel, I collaborated on building new digital presences for Scratch House and El Terrón Golf Club—two high-end lifestyle brands. These websites focused on elegance, exclusivity, and ease of access to information and booking processes. For Grupo Tagle’s corporate site and motorcycle divisions (Motoplex and Royal Enfield), the goal was a clean, brand-aligned presence that inspired trust and action.

At Autocity and Grupo Tagle, I also had the opportunity to **establish the UX/UI design discipline from the ground up**, bringing structure and a user-centered mindset to a context that had previously relied on more traditional approaches.

This experience helped me apply my UX/UI design expertise to very different audiences and expectations, maintaining quality and performance across the board.

projectsData.title: Crafting Bespoke Digital Identities: Custom Web Solutions for Unique Brands
projectsData.description: I created tailored digital experiences for distinctive brands, from luxury services to innovative startups, focusing on custom design and strategic user experience.
projectsData.longDescription:
I designed and launched a sleek online store for **Sixto Van Garret**, a premium lifestyle brand. The goal was to reflect elegance and exclusivity through a simple and effective e-commerce experience.

### 🎯 Goal
Launch a simple, functional e-commerce site for a high-end lifestyle brand, with a strong focus on visual aesthetics and user experience.

### 🛠️ How i did it
Built using **Tienda Nube** for quick deployment. The design was customized with a dominant **gold color palette** to reflect the brand’s premium identity. Clear navigation and content hierarchy let the product visuals take center stage.

### ✨ What stands out
Minimalist layout with a luxurious feel. Gold accents elevate the brand image without overwhelming the interface.

### 📦 Result
A clean, stylish store — easy to navigate, visually striking, and ready to grow.

projectsData.title: Strategic Digital Transformation: Full-Cycle Development for Enterprise Solutions
projectsData.description: I led comprehensive digital projects from conception to deployment, delivering scalable enterprise solutions with focus on user experience and business objectives.
projectsData.longDescription:
👉 **Role**: UX/UI Designer & Product Collaborator
📍 **Focus areas**: Beauty tech, healthcare systems, internal incubator, communication design

---

🔧 **What I did**

- Designed user flows and interfaces for an esthetic equipment rental system and a companion app for estheticians to manage their business
- Improved UX/UI and developed new tools within **Red Sanitaria** and **Retia Health** platforms (for hospitals, clinics, and dental practices)
- Created a fully interactive **odontogram tool** for dental record-keeping
- Contributed to automation features like billing flows and clinical data inputs
- Designed graphic pieces for internal and external communication materials

📈 **Innovation & Strategy**

- Collaborated with the internal incubator to design commercial presentations and craft budgets for early-stage ventures
- Participated in the design of MVPs for new business ideas, including automotive sales tools

🛠️ **Tools & tech**

Figma, HTML/CSS, JavaScript, Adobe Suite, internal APIs, Notion
→ Applied UX writing, accessibility guidelines, and agile iteration cycles

🤝 **Cross-team collaboration**

Worked alongside product owners, healthcare specialists, and commercial leads to align design and business value.

---

At Deep Creek Solutions, I worked across product design, UX/UI enhancements, and commercial innovation. **I initiated the UX/UI practice within the company**, designing digital products for the beauty tech sector, including an equipment rental platform and a mobile-first app for estheticians to manage bookings, clients, and payments.

Parallel to this, I was involved in healthtech products like **Red Sanitaria** and **Retia Health**, where I improved interfaces for hospitals, clinics, and dental offices. A key highlight was designing an interactive odontogram for dentists and helping automate billing processes in clinical environments.

Beyond product work, I also supported the company’s internal incubator: crafting sales decks, budgeting proposals, and early MVPs for new business ideas. Additionally, I created visual assets and communication pieces to support marketing and project presentations.

My role combined creative UX thinking, visual design, and business-oriented solutions to turn ideas into impactful products and materials.

- Developed and executed **internal communication campaigns** across Apex sites in Latin America
- Created **signage systems** (arquigrafía) for multiple office locations, ensuring consistent brand expression
- Designed **branded content** for internal channels, newsletters, and events
- Provided occasional support for digital experiences like intranets and corporate websites
- Collaborated with the **Innovation team** on company-wide sprints using **Design Sprint methodology**

📈 **Key contributions**

- Enhanced employee engagement through clear, visually cohesive messaging
- Helped shape Apex’s internal brand across Argentina, Chile, Colombia, Paraguay, and Honduras
- Contributed to ideation and prototyping phases of innovation projects across departments

💡 **Highlights**

- Participated in multidisciplinary innovation programs using iterative, design-led processes
- Created signage adapted to the identity and architecture of each office location
- Supported HR, innovation, sustainability, and sales communication initiatives

Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, PowerPoint, internal CMS platforms, Design Sprint methodology

---

At Apex America, I served as an **Internal Communication Specialist & Designer**, supporting communication strategies for employees across the region. My role focused on reinforcing the company's identity through clear messaging, engaging content, and visual consistency in physical and digital environments.

One of my most impactful contributions was the development of **signage systems** and visual branding for Apex’s offices throughout Latin America. I also worked closely with the **Innovation team**, participating in sprints that used collaborative methodologies to solve internal challenges and spark new ideas.

While my core focus was internal communication, I also contributed to digital content, branding for corporate events, and the alignment of materials across departments like HR and Sustainability. This experience strengthened my ability to deliver meaningful, context-aware design in diverse professional settings.
